summary: This document is a chain of emails from March 2019 discussing the status of scanning and transmitting records related to the Epstein investigation. An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York is coordinating with others to ensure all materials (16,000-29,000 pages) are uploaded and cataloged.

persons.name: Mil
persons.context: Sends a follow-up email on March 29, 2019, asking if everything has been uploaded to the W drive regarding the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Both are involved in correspondence regarding the handling of Epstein investigation records, indicating a professional working relationship.

events.title: Follow-up on Epstein records conversation
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney M sends contact information and offers to set up another call to discuss questions about the Epstein investigation records.

events.title: Check on scanned records transmission
events.description: An email inquires whether 16,000 or all 29,000 pages of scanned records were transmitted to 'S', and requests an index or catalog of the materials.

events.title: Follow-up on W drive upload
events.description: Mil sends an email following up on a previous conversation to confirm if all materials have been uploaded to the W drive.

keyFacts: The emails discuss the scanning and transmission of a large volume of records (16,000 to 29,000 pages) related to the Epstein investigation.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York is actively involved in coordinating the handling of these investigative materials.
The correspondence indicates an ongoing effort in early 2019 to catalog and ensure all Epstein-related records are properly uploaded to a shared drive (W drive).
